title: Will Smith and the New Snake Discovery
summary: In 2024, scientists found a new type of giant anaconda snake in South America. Actor Will Smith was there with a camera crew from National Geographic, who were making a documentary called Pole to Pole with Will Smith. They went on a boat trip with indigenous Waorani guides to look for anacondas in the Amazon. They found a big female green anaconda, about 16 to 17 feet long, and collected a scale sample to study. This helped scientists learn it was a new species called the northern green anaconda, which is different from the southern green anaconda. Will Smith also saw a giant tarantula and went to other places like the South Pole and Himalayas for the documentary. The show will start on TV in January 2026.

background_read: This article is about a fun adventure where actor Will Smith joined scientists to find a new snake in the Amazon rainforest. Anacondas are large snakes that live in water and are not poisonous, but they can bite. Scientists study animals to learn about different species and how they live. Documentaries like Pole to Pole show real-life stories to teach people about nature and science.
Article_Structure: WHO: Will Smith, scientists, and indigenous Waorani guides
WHAT: Discovered a new species of giant anaconda in South America
WHERE: In the Amazon rainforest and other places like the South Pole
WHY: To learn about new animals and make a documentary for TV

perspectives.description: Will Smith's exciting journey to find new animals
